title: How to Evolve Dragonair into Dragonite in Pokemon Scarlet/Violet

steps.title: Level up Dragonair to level 55.
steps.content: Level up Dragonair to level 55. You can use Rare Candies, EXP Candies, or battle experience to level up your Dragonair. Once your Dragonair reaches level 55, it will evolve into a Dragonite. [1] X Research source If you choose to use battle experience, note that Dragonair (and its evolutions) are part of the slow evolution group, which means they take the longest to evolve as they need more experience points to level up. [2] X Research source The reason for this is that Dragonair's final evolution Dragonite is known as a "pseudo-legendary" Pokémon. [3] X Research source Pseudo-legendary Pokémon are more powerful than most other non-legendary Pokémon due to having naturally high base stats, which in turn makes them harder to raise.

steps.title: Evolve Dratini.
steps.content: Evolve Dratini. You can find Dratini in South Province Area Six and North Province Area Two and Casseroya Lake, as well as in 3-star Tera Raid Battles. [4] X Research source Dratini evolves into Dragonair at level 30.

steps.title: Dragonair can be found in the wild.
steps.content: Dragonair can be found in the wild. In Pokemon Scarlet & Violet, you can find Dragonair in North Province's Casseroya Lake or South Province Area Six as an Electric Tera Type. [5] X Research source You can also find them in 4-star Tera Raid Battles.
